template.p: Hello there!
You just installed the Odoo for Fast Food Restaurant package. By doing so, we have installed many necessary apps to run your restaurant efficiently.
Discover the basics of this package and explore all the possibilities Odoo offers to improve your experience.

div.class: alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3 d-flex align-items-center

div.p: If you want to execute a practical guided tour of this module, you should Import demo data and try the Demo - Use Case. (In the next Knowledge Article)

div.class: o_knowledge_behavior_anchor o_knowledge_behavior_type_toc

div.a: Do you want to go further?

template.p: You can access every installed App in your Odoo database on your main dashboard.

ul.li: Use the Point of Sale at the desk for your sales. You can also download the Odoo Mobile App on any phone to take orders. And create Kiosks or QR Codes to ensure self-ordering.
The Kitchen Displays will ensure a great follow-up of every order in your bar and kitchen.
Use the Planning App to schedule and share your shifts with your employees.
Use the Purchase App to reorder your products.
Use the Inventory App to manage your stock and receive products.

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: Odoo is entirely integrated into an App. Download it to turn your phone into an additional cashier (and much more).

template.p: By uploading this module's demo data, your database has been filled with a few products, a point of sale configuration and a sample planning.
You should be able to execute the following flows to have an overview of various actions you can quickly execute with this package using Odoo.
Of course, this is just an overview of the features included in this package. Feel free to add new apps, delete/modify demo data, and test everything around!

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-warning pb-0 pt-3

div.p: You didn't import demo data? You can still do it. Go to Apps > Industries > Upgrade your Fast Food Restaurant package and check the related box.

template.p: From the Point of Sale, open your register on the main dashboard.
1. You are ready to welcome your first customers. To do so, select a table on the floor map and select the products they asked for from the list.

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: You can easily edit the floor map by clicking "Edit plan" in the top-right menu when on the table selection step of your Point of Sale.

template.p: 2. To make it more interesting, feel free to create a second order. For this one, select the "Burger Menu Combo" product. You can choose 2 burger options burger options and 4 different drinks. This "Combo" feature will allow you to create a menu with several courses and choices for each.

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-warning pb-0 pt-3

div.p: Don't forget to hit the "Order" button each time you change an order. This will forward the order to the Kitchen Display.

template.p: 3. If you select Max Frite as a customer for your order, you can see that there is a Loyalty Program running on your Point of Sale. Every money spent provide a loyalty point, and 200 loyalty points give access to a free Combo Menu.

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: Manage Loyalty Programs and many other kind of promotions, gifts and coupons in the related page in your Point of Sales App > Products.

template.p: Make them pay the orders to release the table and continue your service.

At the end of your service, remember to close your register. To do so, in the Point of Sale App, select "Close Register" in the top-right menu. You can then precise your cash amount and validate the closing.
Your demo database comes with a kiosk to allow your customer to take orders on your booths. Go to the Point of Sale App and select your kiosk to see how it looks and try it!
Each order will be sent to your preparation displays and if you don't configure a payment terminal for each, they can pay directly online.

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: The kiosk layout is optimized for vertical usage, as most booths use that kind of display.

template.p: Odoo also provides easy self ordering possibilities. Print a specific QR code for each table on your Point of Sale settings and allow your customer to order directly on their mobile phone.
1. After placing your orders, look at our Kitchen Display. Click the "Backend" menu in the right corner to return to your backend, then switch to the Kitchen Display App.
2. Open your preparation screen. Your orders are there. You can now mark them as done either line by line or the entire order by clicking on the top.

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: You currently have two steps in your Kitchen Displays: one for the kitchen/bar and one for the service. You can configure steps in the kitchen display configuration menu.

template.p: 3. Odoo provides your an order status display to let your customer see when their order is ready. It is automatically setup and available by clicking the "Order status screen" button on the preparation display.
Your orders will automatically move from a step to another while you move it on your preparation display.
Replenishment is essential but challenging for a bar owner to systematize.
You have two main possibilities in Odoo to ease your replenishment process.

1. Flow 1: Most products need a human assessment as the remaining quantity cannot be automatically computed. For those: Go to your Purchase App to easily create Requests for Proposal or Purchase Orders.
2. Flow 2: For products that can be tracked, such as bottled beers and sodas, you can use automated purchases. To try it, navigate to your Point of Sale and sell a Blond Beer to a customer.

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-warning pb-0 pt-3

div.p: The stock is only updated when you close your register. Let's do it before continuing to the next step.

template.p: By doing so, you have only 23 beers left in your stock.

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: You can see that there is a reordering rule configured for this product if you go to Inventory > Products > Blond Beer

Reordering rules are displayed in the smart buttons on top of your product. You can see a minimum quantity, and a maximum. Each time the forecast stock lowers beneath the minimum stock, it automatically creates a purchase order to replenish to the maximum quantity.

template.p: If you navigate to your Purchase App, you can see a new Purchase Order that is ready to be sent. You can choose a packaging if your product has an existing one.
You can now email your Request for Proposal to your vendor or confirm it manually.
Once the products are there, you can click the "Receipt" smart button to validate your receipt and add these new products to your stock.
Plan your services easily using the Planning App.
1. First, create all your employees in the database. Navigate to the Employee App to do so.
2. Create your employees' roles under the "Work Information" tab. Some are already created for this demo.

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: If you want to assign them an Odoo user account, you can select a related user in the "HR Settings" tab.

template.p: 3. Return to the Planning App. You can see a few shifts ready to be planned. Select the down arrow next to the publish button and click "Auto Plan." Your shifts will be automatically assigned based on your employees' availability.
4. You can still reassign any shift to adapt the planning.
5. Once you are happy with it, send it to your co-workers by smashing the publish button.
